abstracts.cdata!:
The project has been rated satisfactory,
            in spite of two extensions, undisbursed amounts, and unmet
            environmental regulations. The success is based on three
            major activities of the project: a) the deregulation of the
            mining sector, which stimulated private domestic and foreign
            investment, achieving more than ten percent increase in the
            mining-metallurgic production; b) the investment component,
            which provided a broadened financial support, thus
            attracting commercial banks participation, despite the
            economic crisis problems; and c) the improvement of policy
            and institutional mining operations, which allowed the
            financing of an increased investment demand in the sector.
            The lessons learned show that prompt reactions may result in
            successful operations, when both institutions are quick and
            ready to adopt each others policies and/or recommendations,
            as the case may be. The recommendations of the Mining Sector
            Review resulted in a new Mining Law, obtaining efficient
            gains from the modernization of mining agencies and, in
            turn, attracting private investments. Despite a delay in the
            preparation of environmental regulations, the Government is
            committed to its enforcement, and the private sector is
            fully aware of its benefits.
